intro.description:
In this tutorial, you learn how create key pairs.
If the views you need to perform this tutorial are not visible, select Window -> Show View and select the view you want.
Follow the tutorial steps in order. After each step, move to the next step by clicking the button located at the bottom of the step: Click to Perform (if you want the step to be performed automatically), Click to Skip (if you want to perform the step manually) or Click to Complete (if no automatisation is available). If you do not use the buttons to move between steps, the automated tutorial functions become inavailable. To start this tutorial, click the Click to Begin button below.

item.title: Create and store a key and a certificate on your computer.
item.description: Create a private key and a self-signed certificate with an external program, for example, with the Certificate Generator command line tool. Store the key and the certificate on your computer.

item.title: Open the Handle Key Pairs wizard and create the key pair.
item.description: Select Tools -> Handle Key Pairs. The Handle Key Pairs wizard opens. Click New. Name the key pair "Tutorial key". Browse to the private key file for the existing private key. Browse to the certificate for the existing certificate. Enter a password for the key pair. Check the Save password box if you want to save your password. Click Make Keys to create the new key pair.
